framed.model.cbmodel module¶

class framed.model.cbmodel.CBModel(model_id)¶

Bases: framed.model.model.Model

add_gene(gene)¶

Add a gene metabolite to the model. If a gene with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:gene (Gene) – gene
add_ratio_constraint(r_id_num, r_id_den, ratio)¶

Add a flux ratio constraint to the model.

Parameters:
  • r_id_num (str) – id of the numerator
  • r_id_num – id of the denominator
  • ratio (float) – ratio value
Returns:

identifier of the pseudo-metabolite
Return type:

str
add_reaction(reaction)¶

Add a single reaction to the model. If a reaction with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:reaction (CBReaction) – reaction
add_reaction_from_str(reaction_str, default_compartment=None)¶

Parse a reaction from a string and add it to the model.

Parameters:
  • reaction_str (str) – string representation a the reaction
  • default_compartment (str) – default compartment id (optional)

Notes

If the metabolites specified in the reaction are not yet in the model, they will be automatically added. You can specify the compartment for new metabolites using the optional argument. However, if you want to use multiple compartments you will have to change them manually afterwards.

detect_biomass_reaction()¶

Detects biomass reaction in the model (searches by objective coefficient)

Returns:first reaction that matches (or else None)
Return type:str

set_flux_bounds(r_id, lb, ub)¶

Define flux bounds for one reaction

Parameters:
  • r_id (str) – reaction id
  • lb (float) – lower bound (use None to represent negative infinity)
  • ub (float) – upper bound (use None to represent positive infinity)

  • gpr (GPRAssociation) – GPR association

Define lower bound for one reaction

Parameters:
  • r_id (str) – reaction id
  • lb (float) – lower bound (use None to represent negative infinity)

Parameters:coefficients (dict) – dictionary of reactions and coefficients

Define objective coefficient for a single reaction

Parameters:
  • r_id (str) – reaction id
  • coeff (float) – reaction objective (default: 0)
set_upper_bound(r_id, ub)¶

Define upper bound for one reaction

Parameters:
  • r_id (str) – reaction id
  • ub (float) – upper bound (use None to represent positive infinity)

class framed.model.cbmodel.GPRAssociation¶

Base class for modeling Gene-Protein-Reaction associations.

Each GPR association is composed by a list of proteins that can catalyze a reaction. Each protein is encoded by one or several genes.

get_genes()¶

Return the set of all genes associated with the respective reaction.

class framed.model.cbmodel.Gene(elem_id, name=None)¶

Base class for modeling genes.

class framed.model.cbmodel.Protein¶

Base class for modeling proteins.

One protein is composed of a list of genes encoding one or more subunits.

framed.model.fixes module¶

Fixes to clean up common models from different sources/groups.

Author: Daniel Machado

framed.model.fixes.clean_bigg_ids(model)¶
framed.model.fixes.clean_bounds(model, threshold=1000)¶

Remove artificially large bounds (unbounded = no bounds).

framed.model.fixes.default_fixes(model)¶

Apply default fixes to a constraint-based model

Parameters:model –

Returns:

framed.model.fixes.fix_cb_model(model, flavor=None)¶

Apply fixes to known issues in a constraint baised model.

Parameters:
  • model (CBModel) – model
  • flavor (str) – model flavor (optional)

Notes

Currently supported flavors: ‘cobra’ (old style format from the Palsson lab)

framed.model.fixes.fix_cobra_model(model, remove_boundary=True, set_reversibilty=True, use_infinity=True, clean_ids=True)¶
framed.model.fixes.fix_reversibility(model)¶

Make reaction reversibility consistent with the bounds.

framed.model.fixes.remove_boundary_metabolites(model, tag=None)¶

Remove remove boundary metabolites.

framed.model.model module¶

This module defines base classes for metabolic modeling.

Author: Daniel Machado

class framed.model.model.AttrOrderedDict¶

Bases: collections.OrderedDict

class framed.model.model.Compartment(elem_id, name=None, size=1.0)¶

Base class for modeling compartments.

class framed.model.model.Metabolite(elem_id, name=None, compartment=None, boundary=False)¶

Base class for modeling metabolites.

class framed.model.model.Model(model_id)¶

Base class for all metabolic models implemented as a bipartite network. Contains the list of metabolites, reactions, compartments, and stoichiometry.

add_compartment(compartment)¶

Add a single compartment to the model. If a compartment with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:compartment (Compartment) – compartment to add
add_metabolite(metabolite)¶

Add a single metabolite to the model. If a metabolite with the same id exists, it will be replaced. If the metabolite compartment is defined, then it must exist in the model.

Parameters:metabolite (Metabolite) – metabolite to add
add_reaction(reaction)¶

Add a single reaction to the model. If a reaction with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:reaction (Reaction) – reaction to add
add_reaction_from_str(reaction_str, default_compartment=None)¶

Parse a reaction from a string and add it to the model.

Parameters:
  • reaction_str (str) – string representation a the reaction
  • default_compartment (str) – default compartment id (optional)

Notes

If the metabolites specified in the reaction are not yet in the model, they will be automatically added. You can specify the compartment for new metabolites using the optional argument. However, if you want to use multiple compartments you will have to change them manually afterwards.

remove_compartment(c_id, delete_metabolites=True, delete_reactions=False)¶

Remove a compartment from the model.

Parameters:
  • c_id (str) – compartment id
  • delete_metabolites (bool) – delete metabolites inside this compartment (default: True)
  • delete_reactions (bool) – delete reactions that occur (totally or partially) in this compartment (default: False)
remove_compartments(c_ids, delete_metabolites=True, delete_reactions=False)¶

Remove a compartment from the model.

Parameters:
  • c_ids (list) – compartment ids
  • delete_metabolites (bool) – delete metabolites inside this compartment (default: True)
  • delete_reactions (bool) – delete reactions that occur (totally or partially) in this compartment (default: False)

framed.model.transformation module¶

Module for model transformation operations.

Author: Daniel Machado

framed.model.transformation.disconnected_genes(model)¶
framed.model.transformation.disconnected_metabolites(model)¶
framed.model.transformation.make_irreversible(model, inplace=True, reactions=None)¶

Splits all reversible reactions into forward and backward directions.

Parameters:
  • model – Model (or CBmodel)
  • inplace (bool) – change model inplace (default), otherwise create a copy first
  • reactions (list) – split only reactions in this list (optional)
Returns:

mapping of old reaction ids to splitted reaction ids
Return type:

dict
framed.model.transformation.simplify(model, inplace=True)¶

Removes all blocked reactions in a constraint based model

Parameters:
  • model (CBModel) – model
  • inplace (bool) – change model inplace (default), otherwise create a copy first
Returns:

lists of removed reactions, metabolites, and genes
Return type:

tuple

Module contents¶

This package implements all model classes and some model modification utilities.
